path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\01. Main Theme - Pikmin.mp3
description: This remix is actually wild. They wanted to make hard rock Pikmin happen but the source material really doesn't allow for it. They just hang on this one chord for a long time, and there is a lot of dissonance. I don't love the choir. I don't feel like this represents Pikmin very well.
title: Main Theme
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\02. Main Theme - Pikmin.mp3
description: It's not much to write home about for sure. It baffles me that they used this for Olimar's level in the Subspace Emissary.
title: Main Theme
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\03. Forest of Hope.mp3
description: Beautiful, peaceful music. Not really appropriate for a smash match but that never bothered me anyway. It's a classic for Pikmin fans.
title: Forest of Hope
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\04. Stage Clear & Title Theme - Pikmin.mp3
description: For this remix of the title theme they went for samba percussion, a country guitar and also a bagpipe. It really is all over the place, but what can I say, I do like it.
title: Stage Clear / Title Theme
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\05. Environmental Noises.mp3
description: It's a joke! These sounds don't even play in Pikmin. I will never forget being so excited to play Smash Ultimate and the very first match I played, it was a random battle on a random stage and I got the Pikmin stage with this fucking music. I was so excited to hear all the new tracks and I get this. I'm still angry about that.
title: Environmental Noises
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\06. Ai no Uta (Japanese Ver.).mp3
description: I don't love it. Were they struggling to find good music from the series so much that they went for this music that is literally from an advert?
title: Ai no Uta (Japanese Ver.)
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\07. Ai no Uta (French CM Ver.).mp3
description: The mind boggles. Not only did they put in a song from an advert, but it's in French (?), very short, and sung out of tune! Total mystery what this was doing in the game.
title: Ai no Uta (French Ver.)
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\08. World Map - Pikmin 2.mp3
description: This remix is likely many people's first foray into the world of Pikmin music, and that's a good thing because it's a nice track. Pikmin 2's main theme is solid. Also one of two Pikmin remixes to feature bagpipes.
title: World Map
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\09. Stage Select - Pikmin 2.mp3
description: This is how you do a Pikmin remix for smash! It's an upbeat version of a great track, the stage select theme which everyone who's played the game knows and loves. I love the focus on the vibe in general over the melody. It's got a cool reharmonisation thing going on before it loops as well.
title: Stage Select - Pikmin 2
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\10. Tane no Uta.mp3
description: Just bizarre that they put the music from an advert from Pikmin 2 as well as Pikmin 1. It's not as bad as the other ones but I'm glad it's not in Ultimate.
title: Tane no Uta
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\11. Garden of Hope.mp3
description: This remix is all over the place. It's going for an orchestra epic sound, but it keeps starting and stopping. The source material is simply not made for this treatment. It sounds like circus music.
title: Garden of Hope
composers: Asuka Hayazaki, Atsuko Asahi, Hajime Wakai
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\12. Garden of Hope.mp3
description: Beautiful Pikmin music from beautiful Pikmin 3. It's not appropriate for Smash but that never bothered me. Maybe some tracks don't need battle remixes.
title: Garden of Hope
composers: Asuka Hayazaki, Atsuko Asahi, Hajime Wakai
contributors: Asuka Hayazaki, Atsuko Asahi, Hajime Wakai
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\13. Mission Mode - Pikmin 3.mp3
description: Definitely my favourite Pikmin remix. Mission Mode is a banger, and the way they put in the Pikmin voices is great. And then the B section with its fun chord sequence is just delightful. I feel like this is the only remix that truly captures the essence of Pikmin.
title: Mission Mode
composers: Asuka Hayazaki, Atsuko Asahi, Hajime Wakai
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\14. The Keeper of the Lake.mp3
description: This is from the not-very-good Hey! Pikmin and it plays when you fight a giant eel underwater with your blue pikmin. The game has a bunch of excellent music but this is not it.
title: The Keeper of the Lake
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\15. Flashes of Fear.mp3
description: This music is from fighting an floating electrical bee-themed fluff monster in Hey! Pikmin. It's alright but the game had better tracks to pick from.
title: Flashes of Fear
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\16. Over Wintry Mountains.mp3
description: This is music from the snowboarding level in the game. Yes, Pikmin has snowboarding. It's just not the best snowboarding music.
title: Over Wintry Mountains
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin

path: music/smash\Super Smash Bros. Anthology Vol. 17 - Pikmin (Wii, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) (gamerip) (2008)\17. Fragment of Hope.mp3
description: The final boss music from Hey! Pikmin. It actually goes kinda hard.
title: Fragment of Hope
album: Super Smash Bros. Anthology - Vol. 17: Pikmin
